intro: Sycopsis sinensis subsp. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and smooth, grey bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
